snippet: The report on wholesale inventories suggested that growth in the third quarter could strengthen. Meanwhile, import prices rose, suggesting increased inflation.
abstract: Commerce Department reports wholesale inventories rose 0.7 percent in July to $485.2 billion, while sales fell 0.1 percent; Labor Department reports American import prices rose 0.7 percent in August.
lead_paragraph: The report on wholesale inventories suggested that growth in the third quarter could strengthen. Meanwhile, import prices rose, suggesting increased inflation.

headline.main: New Data Suggests Slightly Stronger Growth in 3rd Quarter
headline.print_headline: New Data Suggests Slightly Stronger Growth in 3rd Quarter
